subject: Art
title: What Is Typography?
description: The art of arranging text to make it readable, beautiful, and meaningful.

hook.text: You see typography thousands of times a day: on your phone, on signs, on packaging, on screens. Most of the time you don't notice it ‚Äî and that's the point. Good typography is invisible; bad typography screams.

buildup.text: Typography is the art and technique of arranging type: choosing typefaces, setting sizes, adjusting spacing, and organizing text on a page or screen. It bridges design and communication.

discovery.text: Typography has two jobs: readability (can you read it easily?) and expression (does it feel right?). A horror movie poster in Comic Sans fails at expression. A legal document in a decorative script fails at readability.

twist.text: 95% of design is typography. Websites, apps, books, posters ‚Äî they're primarily text. Master typography and you master most of visual communication. It's the most high-leverage design skill.

climax.text: Look at your favorite app. Notice the font choices, the sizes, the spacing between letters and lines. All deliberately chosen. Now imagine it all in a random font. Typography IS the user experience.

punchline.text: Typography is everywhere and invisible. That's its superpower.

quiz.question: What are typography's two primary jobs?
